alert.note: Alert for Stokes (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 10 at 1:24AM EST until further notice by NWS Blacksburg
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EST THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central North Carolina, including the following counties, Caswell, Rockingham and Stokes and south central Virginia, including the following counties and independent city, City of Martinsville, Henry and Pittsylvania. * WHEN...Until 700 AM EST. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 123 AM EST, river gauge reports indicated that several streams and small rivers were still above flood stage. Between 2 and 3 inches of rain had fallen earlier. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Eden, Reidsville, Martinsville, Wentworth, Mayodan, Madison and Stoneville. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
